Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ son of Barachel (בַּרַכְאֵל) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans are endowed with knowledge, often through experience
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which humans try to determine whether the words spoken by others are true and reliable, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body; ► plays an important role in actions like speaking, blowing, kissing, biting, tasting, and chewing
= process by which the flavor of food is perceived, when eating
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events|= action by which someone evaluates the dependability and/or reliability of someone else ◄ as an assayer examines ore or metal
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= the outcome of a dispute between two or more parties, decided by a judge or a deity
= action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true
= state in which someone has a very serious health condition; ► so that recovery is beyond expectation
= causative event by which deities or humans cause physical or non physical suffering to humans, ◄ depicted as an arrow
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
only used in poetry; = action by which humans express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
literally: to travel in company; hence: = to associate with other people
= state of being associated with other people for a common purpose
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= exclamation expressing a strong conclusion, rejecting the event to which it refers to as inappropriate behavior
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

literally: to cause (someone) to find (an event); hence: = causative process by which deities case humans to eventually undergo a certain event, ◄ as if that event had been sent out to search for them
marker affirming or questioning the truth value of the information that follows
= marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
= causative action by which someone turns patterns of behavior that ought to be right and just into morally or ethically unacceptable behavior
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans or deities give someone else a certain responsibility or position of authority with regards to an object, a group of people, or an entire land or nation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to place (in a position) > to appoint
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans a certain task or responsibility
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= to cause something to move back to the place where it came from

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

Node.gloss: to return to dust|to pass away|to die
Node.definition: literally: to return to dust; hence: = process by which humans die and their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
marker affirming or questioning the truth value of the information that follows
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= action by which humans or deities hold a position of leadership and conduct the affairs of their subjects

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence: = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= action by which humans or deities show a favorable attitude to (other) humans
= person who is wealthy ► and therefore belongs to the upper class of the society; ≈ associated with respectability and moral character
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= a very short length of time
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a point of time in the middle of a larger period of time
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= process by which humans suddenly go through an experience that affects the core of their existence, and die as a result, as if they are suddenly shaken from a fixed position
= powerful person
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about|to set a time
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later|literally: to set a time; hence: = action by which humans or deities determine a certain moment in the future for an event to take place
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= causative action by which humans or deities cause individuals and nations to come to ruin in a violent way
= state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events
= causative process by which humans or deities give events a different nature
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: to strike; = action by which deities administer punishment to humans

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to consider|to ponder|to observe|to take note of|to have regard for|to give heed to|to study
Node.definition: = action by which humans think about someone or something accompanied by a willingness to translate their conclusions into action if needed
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to keep quiet|to keep still|to rest
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities refrain from acting

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans perceive, either with their physical eyes or in a vision

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to hold; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well being of others
= action by which humans act in a morally and ethically unacceptable way

meaning unsure; possibly: = particle linking two elements, in which Y modifies the information presented by X, by which X represents an implicit entity denoting an object, location, time, or manner, and Y represents a negated proposition in which X is one of the semantic arguments
= process by which humans gain knowledge and wisdom; ◄ from what they have observed
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
see אָבִי (אָבִי)|exclamation expressing a wish

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
literally: to add (an activity to one's activities); hence: = action by which humans add additional activities to those that they are currently engaged in
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups

literally: to strike (one's) palms (together); hence: = action by which humans express their anger and disgust by striking their hands together|= causative action by which humans increase the frequency of a certain action
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
